channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on Aug 26
Firms recognised for being innovative in Covid-19 fight
item.description:
August 26, 2020 5:00 AM

When the Covid-19 pandemic struck earlier this year, local cleaning solutions company Spic & Span reformulated its disinfectant solution Speco to be effective against coronaviruses. The product is now being used across more than 1 million sq ft of property, including at Changi Airport.

item.title: 12 on Scoot flight who tested positive no longer infectious: MOH
item.description:
August 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Twelve of 14 passengers on board an Aug 19 Scoot flight from Singapore to Tianjin, China, who had a positive Covid-19 polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test result were deemed not infectious, while investigations are ongoing into the other two cases.

item.title: Three plead guilty over unlawful gathering by 13 at fitness corner
item.description:
August 26, 2020 5:00 AM

A man who went ahead with plans to have drinks with a big group of friends during phase two of Singapore's reopening pleaded guilty yesterday over flouting safe distancing measures amid the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: 7,500 jobs, 1,600 training places in healthcare
item.description:
August 26, 2020 5:00 AM

There will be about 7,500 jobs and 1,600 traineeships, attachments and skills training opportunities created from now until the end of next year in the healthcare sector.

item.title: CJ to new lawyers: Be creative to gain competitive edge
item.description:
August 26, 2020 5:00 AM

In a time of economic uncertainty caused by the pandemic, lawyers who can come up with innovative solutions to improve efficiency and reduce costs to meet clients' needs will gain a competitive edge.

item.title: President visits addiction recovery centre
Female motorcyclist could have hit some pylons: Coroner's inquiry
item.description:
August 26, 2020 5:00 AM

While travelling along Yishun Ave-nue 8, a female motorcyclist may have hit some pylons at the side of the road before losing control of her vehicle.

item.title: Visitors from NZ, Brunei must use TraceTogether while in S'pore
item.description:
August 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Visitors from New Zealand and Brunei who successfully apply to come to Singapore will be required to use the TraceTogether app at all times while in the Republic.

item.title: Over 200 places for trainees in maritime sector
item.description:
August 26, 2020 5:00 AM

The maritime sector has remained resilient amid the Covid-19 pandemic, with container throughput falling by only 2 per cent from January to July this year compared with the same period last year.

item.title: Cousins take down website of foundation linked to them
item.description:
August 26, 2020 5:00 AM

The two men behind a Singapore-registered company that has made a move to take over Newcastle United have taken down the website of a foundation linked to them, saying that it had been "released prematurely".

item.title: Covid-19 reinfection cases rare, experts say
item.description:
August 26, 2020 5:00 AM

News that a 33-year-old man in Hong Kong was reinfected with Covid-19 has sparked fears that people can get the disease more than once. But infectious diseases experts said such cases are rare and not a cause for worry, unless many more cases surface.

item.title: Singapore, Indonesia to discuss green lane
item.description:
August 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore and Indonesia will start discussions on "green lane" arrangements to resume essential official and business travel between the two neighbours, Foreign Minister Vivian Balakrishnan and his visiting counterpart Retno Marsudi said yesterday.

item.title: Company puts blame on 'errant individuals'
item.description:
August 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore-registered Bellagraph Nova (BN) Group said the posting of controversial marketing material "appears to be the result of the actions of certain errant individuals, possibly with malicious intent".

item.title: E-scooter rider gets jail, told to pay injured victim $6k
item.description:
August 26, 2020 5:00 AM

An e-scooter rider was sentenced to two weeks' jail yesterday after crashing into a pedestrian last year.

item.title: Singapore visitors to China must get tested before flight
item.description:
August 26, 2020 5:00 AM

From Friday, Singapore travellers to China will have to take a Covid-19 test within five days before their flight to the country, to ensure they are free of the coronavirus.

item.title: Over 1,000 students at NTU receive aid from uni's relief package
item.description:
August 26, 2020 5:00 AM

When computer science undergraduate Ooi Jun Sheng's parents' incomes took a hit because of the Covid-19 pandemic, the 26-year-old student at Nanyang Technological University (NTU) worked part-time to help ease the financial burden.

item.title: Scoot apologises for e-mail error
item.description:
August 26, 2020 5:00 AM

Budget carrier Scoot has apologised for erroneously sending an e-mail meant for passengers on a specific upcoming flight to a large number of past travellers or those with future bookings.

item.title: New cases at five-month low of 31
item.description:
August 26, 2020 5:00 AM

There were 31 new coronavirus cases confirmed by the Ministry of Health (MOH) yesterday, taking Singapore's total to 56,435.

item.title: Ex-US ambassador quits board of company linked to S’pore group under scrutiny for Newcastle bid and doctored Obama photos
item.description:
August 26, 2020 1:26 AM

Kirk Wagar said he did not have any role in Bellagraph Nova Group, the Singapore-registered company that had admitted to doctoring photographs of former US President Barack Obama.

item.title: Singaporean cousins behind Newcastle bid remove their foundation's website saying it was put up 'prematurely'
item.description:
August 26, 2020 12:16 AM

SINGAPORE - The two men behind a Singapore-registered company that has made a move to take over Newcastle United have taken down the website of a foundation linked to them, saying that it had been "released prematurely".
